L

left - Variable in class plc.project.Ast.Expr.Binary
 
length - Variable in class plc.project.Lexer.CharStream
 
lex() - Method in class plc.project.Lexer
Repeatedly lexes the input using Lexer.lexToken(), also skipping over whitespace where appropriate.
lexCharacter() - Method in class plc.project.Lexer
 
Lexer - Class in plc.project
The lexer works through three main functions: - Lexer.lex(), which repeatedly calls lexToken() and skips whitespace - Lexer.lexToken(), which lexes the next token - Lexer.CharStream, which manages the state of the lexer and literals If the lexer fails to parse something (such as an unterminated string) you should throw a ParseException with an index at the character which is invalid or missing.
Lexer(String) - Constructor for class plc.project.Lexer
 
Lexer.CharStream - Class in plc.project
A helper class maintaining the input string, current index of the char stream, and the current length of the token being matched.
LexerTests - Class in plc.project
 
LexerTests() - Constructor for class plc.project.LexerTests
 
lexEscape() - Method in class plc.project.Lexer
 
lexIdentifier() - Method in class plc.project.Lexer
 
lexNumber() - Method in class plc.project.Lexer
 
lexOperator() - Method in class plc.project.Lexer
 
lexString() - Method in class plc.project.Lexer
 
lexToken() - Method in class plc.project.Lexer
This method determines the type of the next token, delegating to the appropriate lex method.
Literal(Object) - Constructor for class plc.project.Ast.Expr.Literal

literal - Variable in class plc.project.Token
